1) Arrive early and take a moment to relax and reduce your anxiety.
 2) Listen attentively to instructions given by the instructor.
 3) Read the directions very carefully.
 4) Plan how you will use the time for the test. Bring your watch and pay close attention to the passing time. Do not let the pace of others cause you to be nervous.
 5) Do not let difficult questions affect your attitude. Eliminate any choices that you can, then make your best guess and move on.
 6) Rely on your knowledge and do not watch for patterns. Noticing that the last four answers were “c” is not a good reason to change your answer. Change answers only when you are certain. The answer which comes to mind first is often correct.
 7) When answering the essay question, organize your thoughts before you begin to write. A short outline on your “draft paper” will improve your thinking. You should have a main idea or issue, several supporting issues and examples to illustrate the issues.
 8) When answering the essay, paraphrase the original question to form your introductory statement. This benefits you in two ways. First, it helps you get the question straight in your mind. Second, it helps the reader understand how you understood the question and see your perspective.
 9) When answering the essay, write your answer clearly, so the reader will be able to decode your writing and understand your ideas. Remember to summarize your answer briefly at the end of your writing.

The Reasoning Through Language Arts (RLA) test is 150 minutes long and testing is broken down into three sections:

 • Section 1 (35 minutes*) tests all content
 • Section 2 (45 minutes) is the Extended Response portion of the test
 • Student break (10 minutes)
 • Section 3 (60 minutes*) tests all content

The Mathematical Reasoning test is 115 minutes long and is one single section with two parts:

 • Part 1 – (first 5 questions) calculators not allowed
 • Part 2 – (remaining 41 test questions) calculators allowed
 • Students must submit their answers to the first five questions before moving on to the rest of the test. These parts are not timed separately.

The Social Studies test is 90 minutes long and testing is broken down into two sections:

 • Section 1 (65 minutes) tests all content
 • Section 2 (25 minutes) is the Extended Response portion of the test

The Science test is 90 minutes long and is one single section. There are two Short Answer questions included on the test, but they are not timed separately. Students are expected to manage their time and spend about 10 minutes on each of the Short Answer questions.
